intro: Draba staintonii, commonly known as Stainton's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Draba staintonii is a short-lived perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage and producing white or pale yellow blooms in early spring. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
